introduction.title: Maintaining your website is the best investment for your business
content: Professional website maintenance is not just about 'installing updates'. It is continuous care that minimizes the risk of failures, speeds up site performance, increases security, and improves search engine ranking. With reliable support, you save time and gain confidence that your website runs smoothly – all of which builds user trust and increases conversions.

We ensure performance, security, and availability. Our services include automated uptime monitoring, regular CMS updates (e.g., WordPress), backups, removing the effects of hacking attacks, updating website content, and quick incident response – ensuring your site is always available and secure. We also offer modernization services on an hourly basis (a set number of hours per month or open-ended with hourly billing).
introduction.alt: Image of Earth – headquarters of the company providing website maintenance services

fasterwebs.title: Faster websites
fasterwebs.content: Thanks to performance optimization and proper server configuration, websites load faster, which improves user experience and boosts SEO. Additionally, we implement security measures – from SSL certificate installation, link monitoring, and indexing error checks, to virus removal and backup restoration. We use proven technical solutions and processes, increasing website security and enabling continuous monitoring. As part of modernization, we update both the technical aspects and design, and in some cases migrate to newer, more efficient solutions (e.g., ReactJS, NextJS).

cooperation.title: Website maintenance process
cooperation.content: Whether it’s ongoing care or a one-time service, the process can be complex. Thanks to our proven approach, we guide you through every step – clearly, efficiently, and without unnecessary complications. From first contact to post-implementation support, you have full control and transparency. Here’s how our cooperation works in practice:

steps.title: Brief
steps.desc: We discuss your expectations: scope of maintenance, critical elements, priorities, and technology preferences.

steps.title: Agreement
steps.desc: After discussions, we send a proposed scope of services and an agreement (online or in print). In a subscription model, we define a set number of hours per month or apply an hourly rate with no limits.

steps.title: Audit & configuration
steps.desc: The first stage includes a website audit (security, performance, backups), creating an improvement plan, and setting up monitoring.

steps.title: Execution & maintenance
steps.desc: We perform updates, implement security measures, optimize performance, and carry out regular checks. All actions are documented and reported. Upon request, we can rebuild the entire site.

steps.title: Handover
steps.desc: At the initial implementation, we provide a summary of completed tasks, access credentials, instructions, and training. In subscription models, we proceed with ongoing maintenance.

steps.title: Technical support
steps.desc: We provide technical support, backups, and restoration options. Extended maintenance packages are available for clients requiring priority service.

pricingIntro.title: What is the timeline and cost of website maintenance?
pricingIntro.content: The approximate cost and completion time depend on the scope of work and the chosen billing model. In a subscription model, we agree on a fixed monthly fee based on the number of hours included – the client pays upfront for the set number of hours. In an hourly model, we provide a per-hour rate and bill for actual hours worked, based on weekly reports with invoices. The approximate hourly rate range is 50–100 PLN net – the final rate depends on required skills, urgency, and SLA conditions. When preparing an offer, we always analyze your website and recommend the most cost-effective option (subscription with guaranteed hours or hourly billing). We consider the site’s technical state, integrations, migration/backup needs, and expected response time. If an existing site is heavily outdated or built with non-standard solutions, it’s often more cost-effective to build a new site from scratch instead of a costly overhaul. One-time services are also available.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions about Website Maintenance
faq.content: This section contains answers to the most common questions about working with us – from the briefing stage, through technology and tool selection, to project timelines and support processes. Didn’t find what you’re looking for? Contact us, and we’ll respond within 24 hours.

qna.q: What happens if the website suddenly stops working?
a: We first trigger an emergency procedure: confirm the problem, set up a temporary information page (if needed), and restore the latest backup. At the same time, we analyze the cause, fix it, and apply safeguards to prevent recurrence. We keep you informed about progress and the estimated full recovery time.

qna.q: How do you protect my clients’ data and form submissions?
a: We minimize stored data, use encrypted connections, and apply website security measures. Access is restricted only to authorized people. Forms are configured not to save unnecessary data; where needed, we suggest secure storage or encryption. We’ll also advise on GDPR-compliant consents to include in forms.

We always make a backup before updating and – whenever possible – test changes in a staging environment first. If something goes wrong, we restore from the backup and fix the issue. We inform you about risky elements and recommend an update sequence to minimize risk.

qna.q: How can I report an issue, and how quickly will you respond?
a: You can report issues via email / phone / form (as per the agreement). Include your site address, error description, and screenshot. We confirm receipt and give an estimated response time. For critical failures, we activate priority mode and keep you updated.

qna.q: When is it better to rebuild a website rather than fix it, and how does it work?
a: If ongoing fixes consume too much time and money, the site is slow, technically outdated, or prevents implementing new features – rebuilding is often more cost-effective than endless patching. A new project ensures cleaner code, better performance, easier maintenance, and reduced risk of failures, making the investment pay off quickly.

How we do it: we start with a quick audit and briefing to define priorities and must-have elements. We rebuild in stages – developing and testing in a staging environment, migrating content, setting up SEO redirects, and only then switching to production. This staged process ensures critical functions are ready earlier, reduces risk, and spreads costs (milestone billing or full project pricing). Additional services, such as third-party integrations or photo sessions, are quoted separately and scheduled to avoid service downtime.

qna.q: How will I know everything is under control?
a: You receive clear reports: completed tasks, performed backups, and status of critical services (uptime, errors). In hourly models, we also send weekly timesheet reports. After an incident, you get a summary with causes and recommendations.
